      • waitFor

        public void waitFor()
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                    org.ggf.drmaa.DrmaaException
        The routine reaps jobs on a successful call, so any subsequent calls to waitFor() will fail, throwing an InvalidJobException, meaning that the job has already been reaped. This exception is the same as if the job were unknown.
        Specified by:
        waitFor in interface Job
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        org.ggf.drmaa.DrmaaException

      • waitFor

        public void waitFor(int interval)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                    org.ggf.drmaa.DrmaaException
        The routine reaps jobs on a successful call, so any subsequent calls to waitFor() will fail, throwing an InvalidJobException, meaning that the job has already been reaped. This exception is the same as if the job were unknown.
        Specified by:
        waitFor in interface Job
        Parameters:
        interval - Time interval to check job status
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        org.ggf.drmaa.DrmaaException
